attributes.action: Allow full refunds on holidays instead of vouchers
attributes.additional_details: Is these horrible time's people are out of work and had to use savings to get by. Holiday companies should be offering cash refunds so people can use that money for essential living
attributes.background: Ask holiday companies to give full cash refunds

rejection.details:
Arrangements for refunding, changing or rebooking travel are a matter for individual airlines and travel agents, not the Government or Parliament.

We have published a petition calling on the Government to create a fund to reimburse money lost due to covid-19 travel cancellations, which you might like to sign: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/304912

Passengers whose flights are cancelled are already entitled to a refund. In the first instance passengers should contact their airline directly. If you are not happy with your airline's response, you can escalate this to an alternative dispute resolution body or the CAA. 

You can find details of your rights when you fly on the Civil Aviation Authority's website here: https://www.caa.co.uk/Passengers/Resolving-travel-problems/Delays-cancellations/Your-rights/Your-rights-when-you-fly/ 

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here: 

www.gov.uk/coronavirus 

https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/ 

The Government has also created an online service to help you out what you can do if you’re struggling because of coronavirus: https://www.gov.uk/find-coronavirus-support 

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips
